Ok i have been playing this game for 1 hour and 30 minutes and i have waited for so long to be the killer i still havent played a match as the killer but for 
some reason i can always find a game as the survivor it makes me so frustrated.
I tried this game with some friends, We laughed we cried, We screamed like little girls, Remeber kids, Generators are your friends.

This game (in its current state) is FUCKING GARBAGE.  I baught this game specifically to play with my friends, but it is currently IMPOSSABLE to do so.  We spent 2 FUCKIN HOURS trying to join a game together, and still couldn't!  The developers need to get their goddamn shit together.

There are problems this game has, and they need to be addressed. But this is a good game. You will die, you will survive. It's all about learning the killers and survivers weaknesses and exploiting them. You can't just play it for 10 minutes, get your ass kicked, then say it's an awful game.

Easily the laziest, grindiest, most repetitive game currently on the market.
great other then not being able to play as the killer, should be a rotation thing but other then that I like it. Does the job at scaring the hell out of you and keeps you on your toes.

I gotta say playing this game from alpha to beta to release has been a great ride and one I am glad I was part of this game is by far my favorite game. I don't say that about alot of games but this has to be a game I will be playing for a while. I haven't played the release but as soon as I do I will write more in detail about that. Played 115 minutes to stay under the refund limit and I feel like I saw everything in that time. 

Wraiths every freakin game discouraging newbies to play smartly, only played once against Trapper and it was the most fun I had. Wraith is just plain boring, you can't anticipate the fear just look out for those bells idk it's meh. 

Escaping is always the same story of timing LB to avoid generators from exploding. You don't feel implicated since you can just hop off to another lobby once dead. Killers aren't fun at all like I used to experiment it in Damned where some players would just screw with your head but weren't there for killing you 10 seconds in. 

Random levels is...meh, like you just look for the generators anyway everything else is a bit pointless when you think about it.

Ranking and progressing doesn't feel rewarding at all, you lose items you unlock (seriously where the fuuu is my flashlight ??), and the ranks thingy seems very punishing. 

And I can sense from here the dlc ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ incoming with new killers/survivors/items and skins for everything + maps. Just look at Payday 2 if you doubt it, this game as like 150$ worth of DLC'S and a pricetag of 40$ on release, same publisher behind it.

Apart from that, graphics are pretty good but only 3 levels seems kind of weak. Audio is great too but nothing out of the ordinary.
its soooo good my computer cant run it!

few bugs here and there but it's a fun game after you learn the basics

played for a few hours def a fun game but needs changes! while it is a fun game, i have to say it feels closer to early access release title. a few notes you should be aware of as of right now
-no ingame chat
-only ingame text occures in game loby
-you have to search for a party for every match, no round 2's
-you have to search for a match as either killer or victim 
-gameplay is a lil difficult to get use to. 

all in all it's a fun game and is just fun enough to the point where i didnt ask steam for a refund but there had better be updates to this game and fast which i believe will happen.

This game is so much fun. On both the killer and survivor sides.
Can someone help me figure out how to get people in my lobby when i want to be killer i sat there for 15 minutes and no one.

This game is more or less a complete mess, and at the time of launch NOT worth the money. Here's why:

- Locked FPS in game.
- No graphic settings except resolution.
- Extremely buggy, most of the bugs from the beta still exist.
- It's been mentioned 100000 times but you can't play with friends except custom matches, and those don't give you any rewards at all except items you find if you don't die. There's no way to level up, or anything else.
- Really poor balancing.
- You can't change mouse sensitivity in game.
- Not much content.
- Will probably die in a few weeks due to most of the factors above.

If this was a large scale publisher, this game would get lambasted. Instead, it's effectively a early access game, without the EA title, and people seem moderately okay with that.

Unfortunately for me this game is really only fun with friends, and its hard enough to put together a group.

One saving grace though, the forums have a pretty active Looking for Players section, which I'd recommend. The downside, most don't use voice or anything, and they can't really change who the killer is without remaking the room, so you're boned there.

This is one of the few games I've boughten which I've actively told people NOT to buy.

The universe hates just about every aspect of my life. 3 games played and every time the killer homes in directly on me. The third time I got an extra special middle finger to the face, 3 of us spawn together, I hide in a bush since we immediately hear the heartbeat sound. I hear someone get whacked, start hauling ass only to hear the chainsaw guy chasing me in the complete opposite direction of the first person he whacked.

GG Universe. GG. Literally spent 5 minutes outrunning the killer only get wrecked on a hook and have only 1 person escape in the end. Being a survivor will definitely make you sweat a bit.

The only annoying part about the actual game so far is that creating lobbys dont seem to be working. I would like to actively choose to be the killer but for some reason the lobby cant seem to find anyone else unless you hit quickplay.

Great game with fantastic atmosphere! Very unique mechanic. I like tha balance although I hope to see more killers soon (there are 3 currently) The controls feel tight, and matches are easy to get into. Great game if you want something you can play quickly for a round or two, or play for hours.

So I do enjoy the game, the corn field map lacks in regular grass to hide in. 
I dislike that I can only play with strangers online.
1. I understand that having a party full of 4 people VS on random player online is NOT fair.

2. Not everyone has a group of 5 to play offline games, so to make this the only way to with your friends really sucks. 
Playing in a private game with 2-3 people to play with your buddies is not only very HARD.
But extremely BORING and stale. 

3. I think that you should allow a maximum of 2 people to que for online ranked games. 

OR

 at least implement a casual online game where parties of 4 can que, and offer a set amout of points for each game as opposed to what you do in the game.  Standard could be 200 points or something.

4. The balance of the invisible serial killer, and the survivors with no perks on either character is clearly unbalanced.
At least make the jingle between going visible and invisble different, so survivors know which state the killer is entering. 

5. I'd reccomend this game to more of my buddies if the ranked 2 players queing together buddy system is enabled. Or a non ranked where people can play with their buddies, but with people online too, incase they don't have a full party.

Love the concept, but it's such a bummer that you can't play with friends day of release and you can't even communicate with the fellow survivors..  I know they said that you'll be able to do so "SOON", but they really should've enabled these features and not jumped the gun by releasing this game too SOON.

For the Concept, I definitely recommend, because it is fun.  For the lack of features stated above, I wouldn't recommend at the moment and would wait until they're available.

As of August 4, 2016:

They should've called this game "Lobby: The Game" or "Lobby Simulator".

I'll begin by saying I really had a blast playing this game. Never thought I would enjoy catching victims in bear traps and killing their friends as they tried to help.

The game is very fun, however, it feels like an unfinished product.  The lack of in game chat, such as a voice chat that is only hearable by people nearby would make it perfect.  One of the biggest blunders is also a lack of friend queueing.  Also the lack of variety is just astonishing.  All I have to do is watch one Friday the 13th movie and I can figure out a dozen ways to kill people.  And yet they decide that the only way to sacrifice people is through putting them on hooks.  Why can't I let them slowly be lowered onto a saw? Or get beheaded? The list goes on.

[h1]PROS[/h1]
[list]
    [*]2 Spooky
    [*]Great mood setting
    [*]Satisfying as both killer and survivor
   [*]Leveling, items and perks are done in an interesting way
[/list]
[h1]CONS[/h1]
[list]
    [*]No in game voice chat (A system like in Damned would be perfect, where everyone can have voice (mutable)including monster, but you only hear it when nearby.)
    [*]No queueing with friends
    [*]Barely any variety of killer types (Basically all the same but with a small quirk.)
    [*]I can't behead people
    [*]Lack of sacrifice options (Putting them on hooks gets old, why not let me put them on the huge saw too? Be creative)
[/list]

The game has a great base, and it's fun to play, with friends even more so.  I am not recommending the game until they fix the glaring issues such as bugs and no friend parties.  Certainly not worth 30$ in its current state on the lack of queuing with friends alone.

Completely Clown Shoes that you can't Group with Friends this isn't 1999 here people this is 2016..... What developer would have that kind of crazy over sight not to have such a basic functionality in.  Furthermore seeing the massive imbalances currently with some of the Killers.  Hillbilly running mach 12 with a chain saw makes a lot of sense from a ballance perspective not to mention its a one shot kill ability... WTF the Trapper simply slows you down not even a comparison.  Wrath can pretty much just invis around the map again how is this ballanced...  All of beta went by and the devs did nothing to address the numerous post that have now been deleted from the old beta discussion forums.  What where the devs doing during this time, most games the devs are active and pushing small patches to get things ready.  This game is another example of what is wrong with the gaming industry.  Gone are the days of complete games shipping via gold master disk now its we will release trash maybe patch it to an exceptable level and milk every penny before the game tanks.
Excelente juego, es uno de los pocos juegos donde tiene una comunidad solida y encima los desarolladores de verdad se preocupan por sus jugadores. Es el mejor juego para jugar con amigos. 100/100
Survive with friends finally came ^^

If you like losing 90% of the time then this game is for you.  I've played 4v1 survival games, a great example of one (that just got poor marketing due to cosmetic day one DLC) is Evolve.  Evolve shines where Dead by Daylight fails.  

As a survivor you have to deal with (at this point in time) 1 of 3 killers.  The main mechanic to evading killers is awareness (seeing the killer) and your senses telling you the killer is near via a heartbeat sound. However, one of the killers completely circumvents this mechanic.

I'm sorry, a CORE mechanic to your game and everyone is honestly surprised that everyone is picking the Wraith?  How droll.  And for anyone saying "well I've won X games as hillbilly" or "I've evaded the wrath plenty of times"  Guess what,  a good wraith is going to be far enough away from a particular spot (not moving) and unless you have the eyesight of a raven,  you aren't going to spot him in time to run away. 

As the survivor it's an extremely frustrating experience being unable to see your fellow survivors unless they are in mortal peril.  It's also very frustrating having NO communication ability whatsoever.  

I hope Friday the 13th does this time of horror survival genre better.  Either way I don't care what people think about my review.  My opinion and review of this game is that it's bad.  So bad that I'm getting a refund for it.

points, then it's pointless.

Dead by Daylight is a very interesting game. Bringing us into the land of Slasher horror films. Something not a lot of games venture into, if at all.

You can play as a Slasher, or a Survivor. Survivors have a third-person perspective and have audio cues to know if the Slasher is close, but not its exact position. A small red light on the ground shows the Killer's vision, letting you know the Killer is RIGHT behind you when you're being chased, if you even DARE to look back. When you're being chased, the Slasher is slightly faster. But this is balanced out with ways to avoid the killer. Throwing down pallets to block him while you run off in tall grass or hide in a closet or something. Your objective is to activate 5 generators with 3 other survivors, and then escape. Sounds simple, but it's a lot harder than it sounds. There is no voice chat in ranked matches, so plans cannot be made.

There are three Slashers, each with different abilities. You have the Trapper, who uses Bear Traps to trap survivors in choke points during chases, or stop them getting to the generators, from helping survivors, etc. The Wraith, who has a cloaking ability. 

Many users are complaining that this slasher is Overpowered. The cloaking prevents survivors from hearing the audio cue that plays when the Slasher is near. However, before the Wraith can go invisible, a bell toll plays, announcing that he's cloaking. Players then have the option of continuing what they're doing, or be more careful.

Then you have the Hillbilly, that has a Chainsaw dash ability, able to cut down a survivor in one-fell swoop.

All three of the Slashers have a melee weapon that takes down a survivor in two hits. One makes them bleed, two downs them to a crawl. When slashing, there's a slight cooldown for when you hit a survivor. When you hit a survivor, the Slasher wipes the blood onto his sleeve, and he slows down for a few seconds, allowing the Survivor to get a headstart. Fair trade in my opineon. If the slasher was able to do two swings in rapid succession, it wouldn't be very fair.

The goal of the Slasher, no matter the type, is to either kill or sacrifice all the Survivors by putting them on meat hooks. Once again, this is harder than it sounds. Survivors can help eachother, getting others off meathooks, healing eachother, helping repair the Generators, etc.

The game has one core gameplay mode, but two ways to do it. Ranked is as simple as it sounds. Play as a Slasher or Survivor against random online people. Or you can do Kill Your Friends mode, which is the same but in a private match for at least 2 people(One person HAS to be the Slasher). Now, the big difference between the two. In ranked mode, you score blood points which you can use to upgrade your character. Give them new perks, and items to use. However, in Kill Your Friends, this stuff is blocked. I'm guessing this is mainly to stop people from farming points. [u]If this is something that bothers you, you might not want to spend money on this. Be warned.[/u]

Speaking of points. There is a character customization point, or loadout. Which allows you to add items to your character.(As stated above) There's not many choices of clothing and cosmetics as of yet. This is likely to be added in future updates, along with new play modes.

Maps are of relatively medium to large size, all of which are dark and forboding, and are procedurally generated. Generators in a place you might know now, will be switched in different plays.

I think this game is quite fun, and is a pretty good horror game that will make you tense up.

Price is pretty damn low for something of this kind of quality, only $20. Ten dollars more if you want the Deluxe edition.

Go ahead and get this game if you wish, and enjoy yourself, you masochistic maniac, you.
No Party system besides that it's good.

I almost enjoyed this game.  Unfortunately, I cannot give it a recommendation.  This game ran absolutely horrible on GTX 970 - AMD 8320 combo and it also felt very unplished.  I found the menus to be somewhat buggy and the graphics to be sub-par for the performance I was getting.  The overall UI of the menus looked great, but do to the buggy feel, they couldn't win me over.  The game itself was neat.  After playing two matches (and losing both times) I felt like this game lacked any depth or playability.  I felt as if I had experienced the entire game within just those two matches.  I base this feeling on how similar the matches felt.  Both were on different maps and with different killers, yet everything felt the same.  I really wanted to like this game and maybe I should have played a few more matches and also tried playing as the Killer (i had little to no interest in being the killer, I wanted to be a defenceless teenager once again) but I just didnt have the feeling or the urge in me to play that I had been hoping for.  I would buy this game again for $5, max.  I feel bad for saying this but this has been my honest and not very good review.  Thanks for reading.

Dead by Daylight feels like a more horror centered Left 4 Dead. Obvously this means that there is a considerable amount of teamwork invovled but unless you group up with some friends it is going to become very difficult to actually co-operate with anyone since there is no in-game voice chat. Even if there was no voice-chat it would be nice to have some sort of in-game callout system where you could call out to your teammates in hopes of linking up with them, but risk the monster be able to track you down because of it. 

The level up system is very ingenous yet simple. Every time you play a mission you collect a certain amount of "bloodpoints" (basically XP) depending on how well you perform and what you do. As a survivor, healing a wounded teammate or helping them out of a bear trap will award you some extra points, whereas as a monster you get point for killing survivors and trapping them. These points are pooled together and you can spend it however you want. There are three monsters and four survivors and they all do something a little different. Leveling up is going to feel similar to a skill-tree, only instead of a tree, it's a web, and instead of ONLY get perks and abilities, you also get consumable stuff (a flashlight, for example) that you may or may not lose when you use it in an online game (games with friends, however, will not consume these).

You can also customize each survivor and killer (I always choose whatever is hardest to see in the dark or tall grass) which adds another layer of personalization. 

Overall I would definitley recommend picking this up for $30, so far the servers seem a little empty to finding an online game is a little difficult but if you can get 4 or 5 friends into it then this game is going to make a lot of your gaming nights fun.
please make us able to play with friends online :) its much more funn that way ;) i rate this game 8/10 :D

Careful when you purchase.  If you don't read all the fine print you will be ridiculed for misunderstanding it.  Not a big deal at first.  But then the poison sets in.  Like a flock of vultures over a carcass.  Not just the community but the Devs too. The first couple of people were nice about it.  Then everyone just went on a tirade about the post while the Devs just looked and laughed, ultimatley reinforcing the behavior of an extremely cancerous community.

When starting up the game, the first rule of conduct is;

1.  Players CAN NOT (yadda yadda yadda) ...or personally attack anyone.  (or atleast those are the foot notes)

Yet here I was personally attacked about "not being able to read" and "blah blah illiteracy" while the Devs just chuckled.
Yeah ok, the loop hole is, that was a steam thread and not thier personal one or in game.  Great way to skate and contradict what you claim to stand for.

So based on that alone, if this is a Dev team you want to support, then by all means.

Also, (on a non personal note)

When waiting for a game to start (because you cant play ranked with a team of friends) everyone is constantly quitting out to try and match up with buddies.  A TERRIBLE practice that leads to 20 minutes of being "put on ice" between games.  So because of a bad plan, you are unable to just jump on for 20 minutes as the killer and play a few games. You are forced to suffer while a bunch of tweens make it impossible to get a match.

Final Verdict: Meh 5/10

Fun but you cant enjoy it with the people you want, without being limited.  That's not worth the poor execution in my book.

...and based on the bad practices put in place by the dev team, ill be getting my 2 hours worth then refunding...

Great Scare, Good thrills. Im always on my toes when playing this game, the only thing i could hate about this game is the people playing the killers where they camp and you can't do anything to stop it. Overall love playing this game

OLD (OUTDATED): It's a good, basic 4v1 horror game. The variety in the maps is pretty nonexistant. The Killers are decent. The survivors are skin color/gender models with no real skill differences. Overall, worth the $20 I paid. Works with a PUG, but even better if you play with friends.

NEW: Yeah, they have worked hard to give us more variety in killers and survivors and even more variety in maps. It's taken me a long time, and I still think it's very much a love/hate relationship, but it's a good game. Sure beats the stuff out of that other horror game that we can't talk about but you know the one. Best part of this game: NO VOICE CHAT. (Sorry, but I don't want to hear your little brother trying to talk to you, your mom screaming at you, or you chewing while I'm trying to get my horror on.)
You get to be a white trash Jason Vorhees

Loads of fun! 
You know when one of the tags is 'Female Protagonist' these creators know whats up. It feels like you are inside a horror film that is reaching the 3rd act. Its up to you to be the final girl/guy by completing tasks to escape the map. This game does not get old, i played for 2 hours straight and im ready to go back. Despite only having 3 maps the experience is different everytime. The generator locations are randomized. Also each survivor needs to upgrade seperately so getting each player to the full rank should keep you busy. Same with the killer, i had the least fun being the killer. It was pretty frustrating walking around the map looking for footprints/trails of blood. There is no map or hud which makes the experience realistic. And even though we are dealing with a regular player just like us, it is TERRIFYING trying to escape the killer. I havent had so much anxiety being chased through a house since Outlast. Their are some major bugs that spoil the fun but it is still an amazing game for only 17.99 (for the time being) Also im looking forward to more customization items because Im not a fan of the players choosing duplicate survivors. It really takes away the realistic feel and you get mixed up between your teammates. Its a case of Dead Island all over again. Id prefer each player had a different character, in a first come first serve type of choosing. But thats nit-picking. Im hoping with customization items you can really make your version of the character stand out than others.
Meh...Can't join party with friends. Buggy mess.  Beta was used as advertisement.  Refund incoming
Классная игра , но нужно немного оптимизацию докрутить. Сама игра очень захватывает дух и постоянно держит тебя в напряге , очень весело играется даже с 20 фпс ( плес апните оптимизацию) <3

I really enjoy this game! I know I dont have alot of hours played but I wanna give some feedback. Through my couple matches of the game it was fun and it still is but there is not alot of teamwork, and I would just watch as everyone left me to hang after I gave myself to the killer for them to get away. Also there is alot of camping when it comes to the killer. All my games the killer just sits at the hook watching as they die and it doesnt give us the chance to save them. I personally think the wraith is an overpowered killer because I was repairing a generator and it was all good, then the wraith appears out of air with no warning and attacks me. Other than all that I love this game its fun and it gets the heart pumping.

Also I don't know if this is only me but when I try to be the killer I can never find players to join so I have yet to be the killer.
Developers use players as a crutch to make up for the unfun aspects of this game.
Refunded! feels more like a early access game then a fully "developed" game, can really see the 6 year development  put in..... 10/10

So this is going to be my first (and most likely only review) on a game on the steam platform. You will see a lot of negative reviews for people saying they can't play with friends. Yes this is a negative side with the game HOWEVER the people that bought the game should have known the feature wasn't there yet as of date and are giving bad reviews because of a feature we all knew wasn't going to be in at the moment.

The game itself is actually very good, it feels smooth and balanced and with the maps being randomly produced  and different each time nothing looks familiar and everything looks new and fresh.

I have only had a short period of time playing it yet have had some very good experiences and so far NO bad ones on release day. 

Just wanted to clear this up so that you won't think this game is bad because ignorant people didn't look up what was actually included in the game they bought.
This game helped me to realize my potential as a world class hooker.
Yes great game would buy for 30$ has one problem if you buy the deluxe editon on windows 10 you can't find the soundtrack

Time to redo my review.

Game is way more fun than it originally was.  When I first played, there were all kinds of ways to make a game literally go on forever.  Now the games have been streamlined, have a much better pace, and an exciting selection of killers.

Only want to play as one killer, or one survivor?  No problem, you can pick up the other characters perks and apply it to your favorite.  You can also avoid micro transactions, as the game does allow you to use in game earned points to buy killers and survivors.  But if you want somebody today, you can pay a couple of bucks and get exactly what you want.

Cosmetics are also very well done, my Minotaur skin for the Oni regularly gets comments.
Boo

也要抵制外掛跟不良玩家

組隊方面建議能開放跟好友排隊

I played the "alpha" and "beta" of this video game. At first, it is nice to be able to hunt people without worrying about what some activist group is going to do to stop you; but later it just gets dull. I have been sitting in a lobby as a "Hillbilly" for 10 minutes with no one joining, the victims can escape too easily through a trap door that only needs to be waited upon with little effort, the killers are just the same "model" with different skins overlayed. Animations are easy to notice that they just reused again and again.
Game play is fun but quickly you learn that there isn't much to this video game. There is nothing special to unlock, there is nothing new to see. Once you have see one thing, you've seen it every way possible. I enjoyed playing this video game but it's longevity is short, once you scratch that itch. Denny Crane.
realy spoopy game, i would recomend if u love spoopy stuff

Dead by daylight is a fun game, but has a list of pros and cons

Pros: 
-Fun horror game
-Good to play with friends
-gets your heart pumping
-You can meet new people
-You can play as the killer
-Many more pros

Cons
- Cheaters (This is for every game not just this one, quite a bit of cheaters here though, be cautious)
- anticheat? (ANTICHEAT IS NOT PRESENT AT THIS TIME)
- Glitches (When on the ground the killer and/or teammates can't pick you up or heal you)
- Killers have a huge advantage with incredible invisibility time
- Lag on fixing and healing generators (The hit space timer is delayed causing people to miss it)

Otherwise this is an amazing game and i would reccomend it to anyone looking for a multiplayer horror game, however, be prepared for the cons that I listed, but also enjoy the pros that this game has to offer. Hopefully some of these issues will be fixed soon. 
Enjoy

At first I was skeptical about this game. I played the first match and was like meh its ok. Then I played another match and was like hmmm this is kinda cool. Then by my third game I got used to the flow of the game and how to play and now I really like it! Ive been genuinley scared in this game a few times too! It could use some minor improvements as far as content goes but the developers have already adressed this saying that DLC would be coming soon. Dont get discouraged by the acro "DLC" as NONE of the DLC will be pay-to-win. Mostlikely it will be new killers/maps. Id also like to see new game modes in the future! All in all this game is great on its own but it has so much potential to really be something amazing! Only time will tell!
